ratings.comment: Extremely knowledgeable about physics. Lectures can be somewhat dry but he tells funny stories which makes them better. Highly recommend as a professor for Physics 307.

Continues the legacy of bad physics professors. Extremely dry voice. Claims to do practice problems that are "similar" to ones on the exams, but they're completely different. Past practice exams might give you insight into a few multiple choice questions. However, the test requires you to "expand your understanding" so much that a 30% can pass.

Winokur is very nice, funny & clearly loves physics, which makes his lectures enjoyable. However his teaching could be improved. Exams were very tough but lots of practice material was provided & the curve was generous. Doing the readings & discussion worksheets is a must. If you never took AP physics, Winokur is going to make you work hard.

Winokur is not a very good professor, I learned very little from lecture. I would recommend any other professor for 207. I would also recommend joining PLC. It is one of the most difficult classes I have ever taken, especially with no physics background.
*draws free-body diagram* "The physics is over. The rest is just math."
Honestly couldnt follow this guy for the life of me. I just spent the whole semester reading the textbook to support my grade!

Winkour was often very rude in office hours and told me to drop rather than offer help. The exams are difficult and unfair. The average is only around 65 because anyone who already took AP Physics can ace the exams. If you have never taken physics before, then take 103.

The people who give Michael a bad rep are the ones who copy homework and expect exams to be example problems verbatim. That's not how physics works. You have to study and actually understand the material to get a good grade, what a surprise? Seriously, if you do the homework you'll do fine, he's a great guy and very lenient on grading.
Keep up with weekly homework, labs, and discussions and you're good to go. With some studying.

Winokur goes at a decent pace for half the course and then he goes turbo for the last month. Read the textbook thoroughly and understand the CONCEPTS instead of plug&chug. Study past exams and disc sheets, and make sure you know kinematics and forces like the back of your hand. The review sessions were really helpful too. His dry humor was my life.

Physics is a hard course and having Winokur makes it that  much worse. He is a terrible lecturer reads straight from the slides which aren't helpful and he never fully answers questions. Exams are crazy difficult compared to previous exams or discussion worksheets. Nice guy and all but definitely not an ideal professor. The book is more helpful.

It was my first physics class, so I didn't think he was too bad. However, now that I'm in second semester with another prof, it's clear he is very bad at explaining things, particularly at an intro physics level. He flies through the material and lectures in a way that goes over the head of most students. Very knowledgable, just bad at teaching.

Super nice guy. Really cares about physics and is very understanding and willing to help with any problems students are having. Unfortunately, he is just a really bad teacher. He's very smart, so I think he expects people to be able to keep up with him when really he is just flying through lecture leaving a bunch of kids lost and drooling.

Michael was incredibly accommodating. Concepts are manageable, but applying them is difficult, especially on exams. He means well and knows his stuff, but he's not the best at teaching it to his students. Labs are fine, discussions are highly recommended, online homework is Google-able. High School or AP physics would be beneficial, or take 103/4.

By far the most challenging course I've taken. Material presented in lecture is  pretty straight forward, but discussion questions and exams are difficult. Avoid physics 207/8 if you can (take 103/4 instead)! The professor is a very nice person, but has difficulty explaining concepts in a way in which students would understand. Expect weekly HW!

He's a really nice person and willing to answer the students' questions. However, his teaching was confusing, and he digressed a lot when answering questions. Exams were much worse. The lectures were presented in a simple way, but the exams were insanely difficult!  You have to work .a lot outside the class to be able to answer those questions

I'd the course itself it's ok if u've learned about AP physics or some other courses. However, the class is not very organized. Michael spent  only 2 weeks to finish next 8 chapters and students had barely no time to prepare the exam. In addition, the schedule for exams is crazy! Only 2 weeks between the last midterm and the final!
Winokur's tests will make you cry, but you'll be a better student for the experience.

You can tell he really knows his physics. He tries to help, but he doesn't know how to explain physics in a lecture setting very well. His explanations aren't clear, and his lectures are too fast-paced for actual understanding. I wouldn't go out of my way to take a class from him again, but I wouldn't actively avoid taking another class from him.

He is really intelligent and knows the material very well. However, his teaching is too hard too understand, and he often does not answer questions straight to the point. His exams are so hard (it's nothing like the home work problems). The class average is often around 50-60%, which is a B. To be fair, he curved it very nicely!

This professor is clearly very knowledgable about physics. However, he does not know how to teach an introductory class. He is awful at explaining concepts and answering questions. He expects everyone to have a mind that works similar to his and just catch on without much explanation. Exams are much harder than any other 103 professor.

He knows his stuff and expects the best of his students to be clever and to have a full conceptual understanding , not just what is provided in the book. Sometimes this is an unreasonable expectation; however, his tests are curved very fairly and I think that, by and large, the class is pretty fair. Also, he goes off on tangents a lot.

Winokur is one of the most caring professors you'll find at Madison. He is the only professor I have ever heard of who memorizes the names of all the students in his 80+ person lecture. However, he is not good at responding to questions and he gets off topic pretty frequently.
Lectures are disorganized. Exams are incredibly difficult, but curved generously. Friendly and helpful if you ask for it.

He really cares about his students and is very passionate about his field. With that being said, he is a poor, slightly disorganized lecturer and isn't very good at directly answering questions. If you can ask the right questions, you'll get a good answer. Don't worry about raw score on his tests, he's going to curve the crap out of it. Decent prof

About two weeks in this guy told me I was going to fail. He doesn't really care about his students, and overall isn't that helpful. I got through this class because of an awesome TA, not because of Winokur.

Never opened my book although all of the online homework are problems from the book.  Lectures were disorganized and not that helpful.  Exams are hard beyond belief.  Average score in 50-60.  By some miracle I pulled out an A because I spent 8 consecutive hours studying for the final the day before.  Good luck getting through this class

Honestly, the worst professor I have ever had. He can't write an exam to save his life. His lectures are riddled with mistakes. Expects way too much out of his students for an intro class. Avoid at all costs.

Prof. Winokur's was alright.  He sort of stumbled through each lecture, so they weren't all too helpful.  The exams were hard at times, but always fair.  Just do the homework and go to discussion and you'll be fine!

Smart man, but clumsy. Extremely rushed and over-packed lectures. Doesn't explain anything well. Homework is difficult and exams are tricky and cruel. Obviously has a problem writing exams, because they are usually poorly-worded and the whole problem relies on making some obscure connection that wasn't mentioned in class.  Avoid if you can.

He obviously cares about his students, but he has a hard time makin test appropriate for students. He knows and admits he isn't great at writing exams. The curve is very helpful. He shared half of the semester with Prof. Deniz Yavuz

He has a problem teaching at a level that 207 students can understand. He goes through lectures very quickly and his exam questions are very difficult to understand and even attempt. Average exam scores will be in the 50s.

He's a very smart guy, but has a really difficult time dropping down to the level of Physics 207 to teach the material effectively effectively. His tests are rough, but the curve helps. If you're struggling, I highly recommend the Physics Learning Center.

Harder class, and Prof Winokur doesn't do a great job of making it easier, but then, it's physics.  Going to lectures is better than just reading the notes, which exist online for the taking.  Online homework can take time, but is a great teaching tool.  25 tries per problem lets you try every possible method until the right one comes along.  Read.

Definitely not a great professor. Personally, he wasn't very helpful when I asked him about questions, and I've taken physics before and done well so I was surprised it was so hard. Wouldn't recommend taking his class.

He doesn't teach well at all. Going to lectures is useless because he wastes times deriving equations, so you have to teach yourself everything. He seems like a nice person, but I really regret taking his class.

Physics in general is a hard subject and this prof does nothing to make it easier. Lectures just add to the confusion. I recommend getting a tutor and reading the book. Past exams are good to do, but no similar problems appear on the exams.  Only take this class if you have 6+ hours a week to teach yourself and do the painful online homework.

Hey teaches the first part of the class very well but once you get to the harder chapters, he doesn't really do that great of a job teaching.  He's a nice guy and will help you out on homework via email.  Make sure you study the last few chapters the most

He's a great guy and knows his stuff, but not good at teaching a lecture hall. In office hours he's useful, but lecture is pointless. However you need the book more than anything. Keep in mind, this is a difficult class NO MATTER the professor. Only take 201/202 or 207/208 if you must, otherwise take 103/104 and save your sanity.

Nice guy, pretty smart too, but completely useless as a professor. Generally does a very poor job of explaining concepts; he relies way too much on demos(also lacking good explanation) and heavily algebraic examples. The textbook is pretty much the only way to learn anything in this class....expect to spend many hours using it.

Winokur is a train wreck of a professor. I feel like I get dumber by attending lectures. He only does algebra on the board, and hardly ever talks about physics. I'm also annoyed by his vocal intonation.

Lecture was useless, so I didn't go. He tried to do problems in lecture, but emailed everyone later to tell them he got them wrong. I only had to do calculus once, and the problem would've been easier if I hadn't. As long as you know how to use the equations, you should be fine. The 8x11 cheat sheet you get during exams helps a lot.

Winokur is "punny" (pun mixed with funnY!) plus he's almost entertaining!!    But...this class is useless.  He's a nice guy, and you can tell he really cares about the students, but the material is useless and terrible.  Overall, it's not his fault it's a crap class.  I really don't think a different teacher would have made this class any better.
Lectures are utterly useless when trying to do well for a test
This class is horrible.  Exams are murder.  He is a nice guy who loves teaching--and entertaining, but--too bad, he sucks at it.
He is helpful and a really nice guy.

This class was horrible! Prof relied on powerpoint and stupid 'clickers'. Do not take with him if you don't already have a background in phys, or hope to get an awesome TA. I drop-kicked myself down to Phys 103 after this disaster :(

Winokur was the worst prof ever.  His lectures are useless, he spent half the time explaining one problem only to later say he got it wrong.  His tests had nothing to do with anything we learned.  Your text book will be your best friend.

If you already know a lot of basic physics and want to be entertained...take this class. He is awesome! Very funny. I really enjoyed lectures but didn't actually learn anything. I already knew all the stuff but went just to be entertained. I wouldn't reccomend if you don't already understand physics.

If you can avoid him, do.  He is a nice guy and seems to care about his students.  However, he's a very poor lecturer.  Doesn't have a good sense of when to elaborate on a particular topic and when to let it go.  Demos, while interesting, are not well-explained.  Luckily, you'll only have to put up with him for half the class, since it's team-taugh

Winokur is a nice guy and he means well, but he is a very bad teacher.  I learned very little from lecture and relied on the book.  Unfortunately his exam material had little to do with what was done in the book.  It wasn't unusual for me to spend 4+ hours on homework.  Stay far away from this class.
He cares about his students. Hard exams, homework always takes longer than necessary. Overall a good professor.
The format of his test questions did not match the lecture material or the homework.  He is awkward in lecture and the lecture itself accomplishes nothing.

Overall he tries to help you out during lecture. He relies too much on the class survey of answers and if most of the class is on board, he won't bother to explain a problem or help those who aren't on board. Homework is difficult, tests are easier, and the curve is pretty fair.  A little awkward looking, which is distracting. Don't take this class
He seems to be very confused during lecture.  Doesn't really help much.  I learn more by reading the book than lectures.  Tests are somewhat easy, but homework is hard.
Even with his lack of clarity and unhelpful lab descriptions, he's willing to give you a second (or third) chance to fix things.
Teaches very poorly and is not helpful.  Lectures are terrible.
possibly the worst class i've ever taken.

The man honestly does try to teach and he seems to care, but he is quite possibly the worst professor ever. Lecture is pointless and exams are impossible. The curve is pretty unfair too. Unfortunately I had no other choice for 207. Your book will save you.

WOW.  This man was easily the worst professor ever (teaching-wise). My heart really goes out to him, because I really think he tries hard, but he's just not effective whatsoever. Also, don't even try to prepare for his exams because the review sessions are nothing like the exam questions.  When the class average for an exam is 60%, thats a bad sign

Winokur's lectures contain a lot of content, but there is nowhere near enough time for him to explain much.  He makes very long power point presentations, and only spends a few seconds on most slides, which makes it incredibly frustrating to take notes.  His exams, while challenging, are fair.  Nice guy, but not a very effective teacher.

Horrible professor, doesn't teach at all! Do not take his class! If you absolutely need to take it, buy the homework manual and expect to see a whole lot of your TA, although that doesn't help much with his exams..
Sucks

Terrible!  All he did in lecture was give us formulas and somehow we were supposed to be able to understand complex problems on our own.  He always threw in exam questions that had stuff in them that we didn't even learn yet.  Don't even waste your time going to lecture.  I hope you are good at learning from a book because that's how you pass.

WORST PROFESSOR EVER!! Do not take this class unless you enjoy learning such a difficult course for the first time, ON YOUR OWN. This man does nothing in lectures to help you learn.  Goes over way too much material and doesnt even touch the problem work, which is what you are tested on. Heed my words of warning, STAY FAR AWAY from this man!!!!

Ah, Professor Winokur, I know more about your son than I do about Physics.  The tests were contrived, and the only reason I passed was because I had an excellent TA.  My advice: Just avoid this man.  I THINK he tries hard, but is very ineffective as a professor.

Lecture was pointless.  Nothing made sense.  His tests were impossible and didn't test anything that we exdpected to need to know, just stupid fine points.  He actually had to apologize to us for how hard his test was.  Avoid him at all costs... on second thought, avoid the whole physics department.

It was almost pointless to go to lectures because I came out more confused about the material.  The tests are way too difficult (the average test scores are in the 50's).  I only endured physics to get to the astronomy classes I want, but I won't take 208 because 207 was so bad.
